overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a practical approach focused on simple, interpretable methods suitable for short time-series data. It prioritizes daily seasonality detection and handles data constraints effectively, though it explicitly avoids complex models due to limited historical data. The step-by-step logic shows careful data inspection and methodical computation but relies heavily on heuristic averaging.
key_insights: Prioritization of daily seasonality over weekly patterns due to limited data (only 4 days available)
Explicit avoidance of complex models (SARIMA, Prophet) to prevent overfitting with short time-series
Hourly averaging as a default strategy for stable short-term forecasts
Rigorous data validation including missing value checks and trend analysis
Pattern replication for multi-period forecasting after establishing stationarity
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with detailed data inspection and step-by-step computations, but relies on simple heuristics rather than advanced statistical models. Includes manual calculations for hourly averages and thorough justification of method selection.
